title: Colombia capital elects first woman and lesbian as mayor
text:
Claudia López, an openly gay politician who has championed efforts to stem government corruption, has made history in Colombia, becoming the first woman and first lesbian to be elected mayor of the capital city of Bogotá.

López, a member of the Green Alliance party, secured a victory in the mayoral elections on Monday after earning 35.2 percent of the vote (more than 1.1 million votes), according to The Associated Press. Liberal Carlos Fernando Galán received 32.5 percent of the vote.

"THANK YOU BOGOTÁ!" López said on Twitter following her victory. "Thanks to girls, young people, women and families made freehand like mine! We show that when we choose what unites us we not only win but we change history! For 1st. Once in history, we won the Mayor's Office of Bogotá!"

¡GRACIAS BOGOTÁ!



¡Gracias a las niñas, los jóvenes, las mujeres y las familias hechas a pulso como la mía!



¡Demostramos que cuando escogemos lo que nos une no sólo ganamos sino que cambiamos la historia!



¡Por 1ra. vez en la historia, Ganamos la Alcaldía Mayor de Bogotá! pic.twitter.com/JPtwS0RUos — Claudia López (@ClaudiaLopez) October 27, 2019

Videos shared on social media showed López sharing a kiss with her partner as a crowd of onlookers cheered after the final results came in.

ADVERTISEMENT

López will become the first openly lesbian mayor of a capital city in Latin America when she moves into her new role. Her victory is being widely viewed as a momentous step forward for the LGBT movement in that region of the world.

"This is a momentous symbol, a sign of change and of good things to come," Renata Segura, the associate director of the Conflict Prevention and Peace Forum and a friend of the couple, tweeted.

This is @ClaudiaLopez, the new mayor of #Bogota, kissing her partner @AngelicaLozanoC in celebration after today’s elections. This is a momentous symbol, a sign of change and of good things to come. That I have the privilege of calling them my friends only makes this sweeter. pic.twitter.com/1LIF9ad8c1 — Renata Segura (@renaticas) October 28, 2019

López is a former journalist known for her vocal criticism of right-wing lawmakers and involvement in anti-corruption efforts, according to BBC. She has reportedly advocated for a stronger police presence on Bogotá's streets and for combating child labor in the area.

Following her victory, López promised to unite Colombians across the political spectrum and to fix issues related to transportation, the AP noted.

"This is the day of the woman," she said. "We knew that only by uniting could we win. We did that. We united, we won and we made history!"
description: Claudia López, an openly gay politician who has championed efforts to stem government corruption, has made history in Colombia, becoming the first woman and first lesbian to be elected mayor of the capital city of Bogotá.
